intro: Scandix pinnatifida var. hohenackeri, commonly known as the Hohenacker's hogweed, is a variant of the hogweed species native to parts of Europe. It is a biennial or perennial plant characterized by its large, umbrella-like inflorescence and deeply lobed leaves. The plant belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and some toxic species. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas and can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in a complex structure that aids in wind pollination.
